longInfo:
Passport required. 
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 4 months beyond the period of
  intended stay. 

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Spain can obtain a visa
on arrival, if: (SEE NOTE 49008)(SEE NOTE 53404) 
 - traveling as tourists, for a max. stay of 90 days. Fee: USD
   50.- (single entry) and USD 80.- (multiple entry). 
 - traveling on business, for a max. stay of 30 days.Fee: USD
   50.- (single entry) and USD 80.- (multiple entry). 
    NOTE 49008: Passport must contain at least one unused visa
   page for the visa sticker. 
    NOTE 53404: The max. stay is granted within one year.
Visa required, except for Nationals of Spain when traveling as
tourists can obtain Univisa on arrival at Livingstone (LVI)
and Lusaka (LUN).  (SEE NOTE 49008) 
    NOTE 49008: Passport must contain at least one unused visa
   page for the visa sticker. 
Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Spain will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- If mentioned in passport of one of the parents, minor does
  not need to obtain visa. 
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination.
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists throughout the year in the whole country.
  Recommended prevention: C.
